articles.content:
The crater in the center of this HiRISE image defines where zero longitude is on Mars, like the Greenwich Observatory does for the Earth. Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech/UArizona

articles.author: Mike McRae
articles.title: These Microbes Breathe Methane And Turn It Into Electricity in a Weird Living Battery - ScienceAlert
articles.description: As far as greenhouse gases go, methane is the quiet villain that could stealthily drag us ever deeper into the climate crisis. In our atmosphere, it is at least 25 times more effective at trapping heat than carbon dioxide.

articles.author: Sam Tonkin
articles.title: Tardigrades can hitch-hike on snails to travel longer distances - Daily Mail
articles.description: Tardigrades are one of the most indestructible life forms on Earth and can survive in outer space. But experts at Adam Mickiewicz University, Poland, found a possible weakness - snail mucus.
articles.content:
They are known as one of the most indestructible life forms on Earth.
